action.action-desc: Mrs. Peltola introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend title 54, United States Code, to authorize the provision of technical assistance under the Preserve America Program and to direct the Secretary of the Interior to enter into partnerships with communities adjacent to units of the National Park System to leverage local cultural heritage tourism assets.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Explore America Act of 2023.
The purposes of this Act are—

paragraph.text: to strengthen economic development across the United States by supporting cultural heritage tourism and historic preservation activities through the Preserve America Program; and

to encourage the Director of the National Park Service to partner with gateway communities (including Native American communities and National Heritage Areas) to leverage local cultural and historic heritage tourism assets.

subsection.text: Section 311102 of title 54, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (d)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting and the Secretary of Commerce after Council; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Advisory role of Secretary of Commerce
paragraph.text: The Secretary of Commerce shall advise the program with respect to job creation, economic growth, and tourism policy and promotion.
by adding at the end the following:

For any fiscal year for which funds are not made available to provide grants under this section, to the extent practicable, the program shall, in lieu of the grants, provide technical assistance to the eligible entities described in subsection (a) for projects that meet the eligibility requirements described in subsection (b), as identified on the list of projects prepared by the Secretary in accordance with subsection (d).

The Secretary may take into account the availability of staff resources at the Department of the Interior, the Council, and the Department of Commerce for purposes of determining the number of projects that are provided technical assistance under this subsection.
The form of technical assistance under paragraph (1) may include technical assistance provided by—

subparagraph.text: the Director, with respect to—

clause.text: the conduct of research, inventories, and surveys;
the documentation of historic resources; and
the interpretation and promotion of cultural and heritage assets;

subparagraph.text: the Council, with respect to historic preservation initiatives and best practices in stewardship; and
the Secretary of Commerce, with respect to economic development and job creation resources.

subsection.text: Chapter 3111 of title 54, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating section 311105 as section 311106; and
by inserting after section 311104 the following:

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of the Explore America Act of 2023, the Secretary, in consultation with the Council and the Secretary of Commerce, shall develop specific metrics to measure the effectiveness of the program, including—

paragraph.text: the economic impact of the program on local communities (including Native American communities and National Heritage Areas); and
the effect of the program on efforts to preserve heritage resources.

subsection.text: Not later than 2 years after the date on which a grantee receives a grant or technical assistance under this chapter, the grantee shall submit to the Secretary a report that—

paragraph.text: describes the outcome of the project that was provided a grant or technical assistance under this chapter; and
based on the metrics developed under subsection (a), assesses—

subparagraph.text: the accomplishments of the project; and
the impact of the project on the community in which the project was carried out.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall submit an annual report to the appropriate committees of Congress that includes data provided by grantees to demonstrate the economic impact of the program.
The table of sections for chapter 3111 of title 54, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 311105 and inserting the following:

section.header: National park service partnerships with gateway communities

subsection.text: Subdivision 1 of division B of subtitle III of title 54, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The term appropriate congressional committee means—

subparagraph.text: the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate;
the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate;
the Committee on Appropriations of the Senate;
the Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives;
the Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives; and
the Committee on Appropriations of the House of Representatives.

paragraph.text: The term gateway community means a community adjacent to a System unit, including a Native American community or a National Heritage Area.
The term heritage tourism has the meaning given the term in section 311101.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall, to the extent practicable, offer to enter into partnerships with gateway communities to leverage heritage tourism assets to strengthen local economies and create jobs in the gateway communities with the goal of establishing a standardized framework for partnerships throughout the System, including through—

paragraph.text: providing financial assistance to gateway communities to support outreach and promotional efforts;
providing technical assistance to gateway communities based on Service best practices in tourism development and visitor management, such as—

subparagraph.text: inventorying tourism resources in the gateway community;
identifying historic heritage and cultural resources;
engaging collaborative partners and stakeholders;
designing community outreach and participation strategies;
developing concept plans for trails, parks, historic resources, and natural areas;
developing sustainable tourism development frameworks for community planning; and
encouraging regional strategies for tourism development and promotion; and

paragraph.text: assisting gateway communities in accessing additional Federal resources available to strengthen tourism assets and support economic development.

subsection.text: The Secretary, in consultation with stakeholders of System units, shall establish a process through which States, units of local government, and Tribal Governments may apply for designation as a gateway community to become eligible for financial and technical assistance made available under this section.
The Secretary, in consultation with gateway communities, shall develop metrics to measure the impact of the financial and technical assistance provided to gateway communities under this section.

section.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report that—

paragraph.text: describes the efforts of the Secretary to partner with gateway communities under this chapter;
analyzes the results of the financial and technical assistance using the metrics developed under section 309202(c); and
identifies—

subparagraph.text: the next steps that should be taken to improve partnerships with gateway communities; and
any actions that the Secretary will take to improve the partnerships.

section.text: There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as are necessary to carry out this chapter.
